title: General Position
content: Points in ℝ^k are in general position if no k+1 points lie on a hyperplane. In ℝ²: no 3 collinear. In ℝ³: no 4 coplanar.

title: Convex Polyhedron
content: A set determines a convex polyhedron if all points are vertices of their convex hull (no point interior to hull of others).

title: Function f_k(n)
content: f_k(n) = smallest m such that any m points in general position in ℝ^k contain n points determining a convex polyhedron. Ramsey-type function.

title: Erdős-Klein-Szekeres (k=2)
content: In the plane: f_2(n) = 2^{n-2} + 1 (Erdős-Szekeres 1935, exact by Suk 2017). Exponential growth.

title: Dimension Monotonicity
content: f_2(n) > f_3(n) > f_4(n) > ... Higher dimensions make it easier to find convex subsets.

title: Erdős's Conjecture (Disproved)
content: For each k, there exists c_k > 0 such that f_k(n) > (1+c_k)^n. Conjectured exponential lower bound.

title: Pohoata-Zakharov (2022)
content: f_3(n) ≤ 2^{o(n)} - subexponential! For any c > 0, eventually f_3(n) < (1+c)^n. Disproves the conjecture for k=3.

title: Conjecture Disproved
content: The full conjecture is FALSE: no constant c_3 > 0 gives f_3(n) > (1+c_3)^n uniformly.

title: Problem Summary
content: DISPROVED: k=2 has exponential f_2(n) = 2^{n-2}+1, but k≥3 has subexponential f_k(n) ≤ 2^{o(n)}. Higher dimensions break the exponential barrier.
